definition: lightning strike/thunderbolt
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]

sentences.english: We have been struck by lightning, the rear fuselage damaged, right elevator lost.
sentences.chinese: 我們遭到雷擊，後機身被打壞，失去右升降舵。

sentences.english: So the main causes for OPGW strand breakage form lightning are the structural design problems.
sentences.chinese: 因此，OPGW雷擊斷股的主要原因是結構設計問題。

sentences.english: Lightning disturbance threats the security of weak current equipments in power system seriously.
sentences.chinese: 雷擊嚴重威脅着電力系統中弱電設備的安全運行。

sentences.english: His house was struck by lightning last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚他的房子被雷擊了。

sentences.english: He looks as if (as though) he had been hit by lighting.
sentences.chinese: 他那樣子就像被雷擊了似的。

sentences.english: The right to water heard such as lightning, home received a wedding invitation to Guo Jiaji.
sentences.chinese: 權水聞言如遭雷擊，回到家裏收到了郭家寄來的喜貼。

sentences.english: Officials have said lightning may have played a part in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 有官員說，雷擊可能也是引發事故的原因之一。

sentences.english: Just as a timepiece stops in a house that is stricken by lightning.
sentences.chinese: 就像被雷擊中的房子裏一隻座鐘停止了走動。

sentences.english: Lighting may have been the cause, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他回答說，原因可能是遭到了雷擊。

sentences.english: Installing those devices also doesn't shield a high-speed train system completely from lightning jolts.
sentences.chinese: 安裝這些設備也不能完全防止高速鐵路系統避免雷擊。

sentences.english: This thesis takes the lightning accident in ZiJin Temple of Suzhou as an example.
sentences.chinese: 本文以蘇州紫金庵遭雷擊事故爲案例。

sentences.english: Computer network power source and signal circuit's against thunder stroke protection.
sentences.chinese: 計算機網絡電源和信號線路的防雷擊保護。

sentences.english: Carmona province and two died in lightning strikes.
sentences.chinese: 卡莫納省有2人死於雷擊。

sentences.english: The total lightning outage rate is closer to the the practical running result.
sentences.chinese: 計人感應雷擊計算的總跳閘次數更接近實際運行值。

sentences.english: Describing my feeling, upon seeing it, as thunderstruck would be an understatement.
sentences.chinese: 如果要說我當時的感受，說是被雷擊了都不過分。

definition: no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
bang/thump
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
poison gas/toxic gas/manifestation of passion, anger etc (Buddhism)
to attack with a bladed weapon
to meet violent death/to get killed
to get an electric shock/to be electrocuted/electric shock
everything
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to take one's last breath/dying
to fall off or jump off a building
wooden sword
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
armed confrontation/bust-up between gangs
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
